About Me

Hi, I am Nithin Senthil Kumar ,

I am a second year Master's student studying Computer Science at The Ohio State University, currently looking for full-time opportunities as a Software Developer. I previously worked at Nutanix for 2 years where I expanded my knowledge about compute, storage and network infrastructure. I believe that if you never stop learning and communicate your knowledge effectively, the world is your oyster.

Experience

Graduate Research Associate, NOWLAB Dept. of CSE, OSU

Apr 2020 — Present

- Currently integrating and optimizing the performance of Nvidia collective communications library(NCCL) into CUDA Aware MPI library - MVAPICH2GDR

- Drove the public launch of Mvapich2-X and Mvapich2-GDR MPI libraries on the HPC package management platform, Spack

- Implemented a benchmark to determine the latency of MPI applications with forked processes

Systems Reliability Engineer - II, Nutanix

Jul 2017 — Jun 2019

- Tech lead of team that won ”Strengthening the Core” @ Nutanix Hackathon 4.0

- Mentored and led the team that designed and developed a web platform [Flask, React, Docker, Elasticsearch] with Salesforce integration to display a live summary of critical alerts and configuration of customers’ clusters.

- Proactively proposed and pioneered automation projects that interfaced with Salesforce, Slack to improve management efficiency.

- Gained expertise in diagnosing and resolving critical performance issues in applications, storage, and networks in production data-center environments.

Engineering Intern, Nutanix

Jan 2017 — Jun 2017

- Deployed a diagnostic dashboard to speed up case resolution times by tracking trends in cluster performance stats.

- Developed and implemented a data extraction and migration tool [PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch, Java] to make historical records accessible for sales analytics.

Summer Research Fellow, IIT Hyderabad

May 2016 — Jul 2016

- Implemented graph coloring and barrier synchronization solutions to parallelize and tune the performance the Finite Elements Method problem.

- Libraries created were incorporated into Mechanical department projects.
